title: >>> The KNIGHTMARE
body_text:
WALL v. ALL 2
No more talking - just a non-stop, heart-pounding dodgeball explosion of epic proportions. The hometown heroes Team WALL prepared for the second wave of unwelcomed visitors known as Team ALL.
Judging by the events that transpired at
DODGEBALL 93
, it was clear right from the getgo that the "misfits" had no alternative but to formulate a good sound strategy and more importantly, the numbers to pull through. The fearless
Knights
needed all of ten participants last time around, and somehow still managed to pick up what was on paper an upset victory.
But the tables had turned for this second clash as the numbers game favored the hometown boys. Though not by a large margin, still, their incredible victory from the previous war proved their overall dominance, overcoming what looked to be a longshot. But along came this heated return war, and the momentum gained from DODGEBALL 93 was savagely used to plow through Team ALL like a plague from hell.
In the ultra-competitive return bout, Team WALL not surprisingly vanquished Team ALL 5 to 0. It could be argued that Team ALL was well on their way to a single game victory, but the lights had shut off signaling the end of quite possibly the most physical confrontation ever witnessed. Regardless of the inconclusive Game 6, the
Knights
reigned supreme at DODGEBALL 97.
The YEARBOOK
Twelve total players made up Team ALL 2. Returning to competition included those from Ocean Township, Manasquan, Allentown, Monsignor Donovan, Neptune, and Monmouth Regional.
Fourteen
Knights
comprised this second formation of Team WALL.
Moments & Stars
: Chris Grasso's exceptional dodging abilities; the numbing ear/faceshot on John Tronolone delivered by Tom Adams; the terrific Game 4 showing from Dan Turner
RECORDS
> Attendance: 26
> Notable Returns: Lenny Herrera (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 87); Dan Karen (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 87)
> New Players: Andrew Cecchetti, Sean Irons
- DODGEBALL 97 played host to the
WALL v. ALL 2
. Team WALL, much like the first encounter at DODGEBALL 93 came out victorious.
- A rarity yet again, there were no captains scheduled for the event.
- The
Letsche Rims
were used for the eigth straight event.
________________________________________
___________________
Less than one month.
You heard right ...
DODGEBALL 98
The most random of warriors thrown together to create one "wild" event! It's the
Wild Card Match
when
Juan Londono
teams with
Wesley Hebrew
to face
Dan Turner
and
Lauren Winston
!
DODGEBALL 99
Icons collide when
Alison Bertsch
goes one-on-one with
Tom Adams
! PLUS, the revelation of the final two DODGEBALL 100 captains! Just wait until you hear what's in store!
DODGEBALL 100
The F*ckin' Big One. This is the moment
we've
been waiting for. An event only dreamt about some eons ago will become a reality. The determination, the desire, the pegeantry, the celebration is coming
August 18
.
body_html:
WALL v. ALL 2
No more talking - just a non-stop, heart-pounding dodgeball explosion of epic proportions. The hometown heroes Team WALL prepared for the second wave of unwelcomed visitors known as Team ALL.

Judging by the events that transpired at DODGEBALL 93, it was clear right from the getgo that the "misfits" had no alternative but to formulate a good sound strategy and more importantly, the numbers to pull through. The fearless Knights needed all of ten participants last time around, and somehow still managed to pick up what was on paper an upset victory.

But the tables had turned for this second clash as the numbers game favored the hometown boys. Though not by a large margin, still, their incredible victory from the previous war proved their overall dominance, overcoming what looked to be a longshot. But along came this heated return war, and the momentum gained from DODGEBALL 93 was savagely used to plow through Team ALL like a plague from hell.

In the ultra-competitive return bout, Team WALL not surprisingly vanquished Team ALL 5 to 0. It could be argued that Team ALL was well on their way to a single game victory, but the lights had shut off signaling the end of quite possibly the most physical confrontation ever witnessed. Regardless of the inconclusive Game 6, the Knights reigned supreme at DODGEBALL 97.

The YEARBOOK
Twelve total players made up Team ALL 2. Returning to competition included those from Ocean Township, Manasquan, Allentown, Monsignor Donovan, Neptune, and Monmouth Regional.

Fourteen Knights comprised this second formation of Team WALL.

Moments & Stars: Chris Grasso's exceptional dodging abilities; the numbing ear/faceshot on John Tronolone delivered by Tom Adams; the terrific Game 4 showing from Dan Turner

RECORDS
> Attendance: 26
> Notable Returns: Lenny Herrera (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 87); Dan Karen (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 87)
> New Players: Andrew Cecchetti, Sean Irons

- DODGEBALL 97 played host to the WALL v. ALL 2. Team WALL, much like the first encounter at DODGEBALL 93 came out victorious.
- A rarity yet again, there were no captains scheduled for the event.
- The Letsche Rims were used for the eigth straight event.
___________________________________________________________

Less than one month.
You heard right ...

DODGEBALL 98
The most random of warriors thrown together to create one "wild" event! It's the Wild Card Match when Juan Londono teams with Wesley Hebrew to face Dan Turner and Lauren Winston!

DODGEBALL 99
Icons collide when Alison Bertsch goes one-on-one with Tom Adams! PLUS, the revelation of the final two DODGEBALL 100 captains! Just wait until you hear what's in store!

DODGEBALL 100
The F*ckin' Big One. This is the moment we've been waiting for. An event only dreamt about some eons ago will become a reality. The determination, the desire, the pegeantry, the celebration is coming August 18.
